objectiveDescription: Achieve and sustain effective management of the enterprise data assets across the data life cycle, from creation through delivery, maintenance and archiving.
objectivePurpose: Ensure effective utilization of the critical data assets to achieve enterprise goals and objectives.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Satisfaction survey of key stakeholders regarding the transparency, understanding and accuracy of enterprise financial information
Cost of noncompliance with finance-related regulations
Degree of board and executive management satisfaction with decision-making information
Number of incidents caused by incorrect business decisions based on inaccurate information
Time to provide information supporting effective business decisions
Timeliness of management information
Level of user satisfaction with quality, timeliness and availability of I&T-related management information, taking into account available resources
Ratio and extent of erroneous business decisions in which erroneous or unavailable I&T-related information was a key factor
Percentage of information meeting quality criteria

subComponents.subComponentName: Define and communicate the organization’s data management strategy and roles and responsibilities.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Define how to manage and improve the organization’s data assets, in line with enterprise strategy and objectives. Communicate the data management strategy to all stakeholders. Assign roles and responsibilities to ensure that corporate data are managed as critical assets and the data management strategy is implemented and maintained in an effective and sustainable manner.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Establish a data management function with responsibility for managing activities that support data management objectives.
Specify roles and responsibilities to support the management of data and the interaction between governance and the data management function.

Ensure that business and technology collaboratively develop the organization’s data management strategy. Make sure that data management objectives, priorities and scope reflect enterprise objectives, are consistent with data management policies and regulation, and are approved by all stakeholders.
Communicate data management objectives, priorities and scope and adjust them as needed, based upon feedback
Use metrics to assess and monitor the achievement of objectives for data management.
Monitor the sequence plan for implementation of the data management strategy. Update it as needed, based on progress reviews.

Use statistical and other quantitative techniques to evaluate the effectiveness of strategic data management objectives in achieving business objectives. Make modifications as needed, based on metrics.
Ensure that the organization researches innovative business processes and emerging regulatory requirements to ensure that the data management program is compatible with future business needs.
Make contributions to industry best practices for data management strategy development and implementation.
string
subComponentQuestions.detailedReference: Data Management Strategy - Data Management Strategy; Data Governance—Governance Managementm

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: string
subComponentQuestions.detailedReference: Service Design, 5.2 Management of Data and Information

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: The CIS Critical Security Controls for Effective Cyber Defense Version 6.1, August 2016

subComponents.subComponentName: Define and maintain a consistent business glossary
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Create, approve, update and promote consistent business terms and definitions to foster shared data usage across the organization.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Ensure that standard business terms are readily available and communicated to relevant stakeholders
Ensure that each business term added to the business glossary has a unique name and unique definition
Use standard industry business terms and definitions, as appropriate, in the business glossary

Establish, document and follow a process to define, manage, use and maintain the business glossary. For example, new initiatives should apply standard business terms as part of the data requirements definition process to ensure consistency of language. This will help achieve comparability of the content and facilitate data sharing across the organization.
Ensure that new development, data integration and data consolidation efforts apply standard business terms as part of the data requirements definition process.
Integrate the business glossary into the organization’s metadata repository, with appropriate access permissions..
string
string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: ISF, The Standard of Good Practice for Information Security 2016

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Business glossary

subComponentQuestions.subComponentName: Establish the processes and infrastructure for metadata management.
subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Establish the processes and infrastructure for specifying and extending metadata about the organization’s data assets, fostering and supporting data sharing, ensuring compliant use of data, improving responsiveness to business changes and reducing data-related risk

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Establish and follow a metadata management process.
Ensure that metadata documentation captures data interdependencies.
Establish and follow metadata categories, properties and standards
Develop and use metadata to perform impact analysis on potential data changes.
Populate the organization’s metadata repository with additional categories and classifications of metadata according to a phased implementation plan. Link it to architecture layers.
Validate metadata and any changes to metadata against the existing architecture.
Ensure that the organization has developed an integrated metamodel deployed across all platforms.
Ensure that metadata types and data definitions support consistent import, subscription and consumption practices.
Use measures and metrics to evaluate the accuracy and adoption of metadata.
Evaluate planned data changes for impact on the metadata repository. Continuously improve metadata capture, change and refinement processes.
string
string

subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Define an integrated, organizationwide strategy to achieve and maintain the level of data quality (such as complexity, integrity, accuracy, completeness, validity, traceability and timeliness) required to support the business goals and objectives.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Define a data quality strategy in collaboration with business and technology stakeholders, approved by executive management, and managed. The strategy should facilitate moving from the current to the target state. It should also explicitly align with business objectives and the organization’s data management strategy.
Ensure that the data quality strategy is followed across the organization and is accompanied by corresponding policies, processes and guidelines.
Anchor the policies, processes and governance contained in the data quality strategy across the data life cycle. Mandate corresponding processes in the system development life cycle methodology.
Develop and use metadata to perform impact analysis on potential data changes.
Develop, monitor and maintain a sequence plan for data quality improvement efforts across the organization.
To evaluate progress, monitor plans to meet the goals and objectives of the data quality strategy..
Systematically collect stakeholder reports of data quality issues. Include their expectations for improving data quality in the data quality strategy. Measure and monitor them.
string
subComponentQuestions.detailedReference: DP.DR Safeguard Data at Rest; DP.DT Safeguard Data in Transit; DP.IP Integrity and Data Leak Prevention

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: string

subComponentQuestions.subComponentName: Establish data profiling methodologies, processes and tools.
subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Implement standardized data profiling methodologies, processes, practices, tools and templates that can be applied across multiple data repositories and data stores.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Define and standardize data profiling methodologies, processes, practices, tools and results templates. Ensure that profiling processes are reusable and leveraged across multiple data stores and shared data repositories.
Engage data management to identify core shared data sets that are regularly profiled and monitored..
In data profiling efforts, include evaluation of the conformity of data content with its approved metadata and standards.
During a data profiling activity, compare actual issues to the statistically predicted issues, based on historical profiling results.
DEnsure that results are centrally stored, systematically monitored and analyzed with respect to statistics and metrics. Provide the resulting insight to data quality improvements over time.
Create real-time or near real-time automated profiling reports for all critical data feeds and repositories.
string
string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-53, Revision 5, August 2017

subComponentQuestions.subComponentName: Ensure a data quality assessment approach.
subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Provide a systematic approach to measure and evaluate data quality according to processes and techniques, and against data quality rules.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Periodically conduct data quality assessments, according to an approved frequency per the data quality assessment policy. Ensure that data governance determines the key set of attributes by subject area for data quality assessments.
Include recommendations for remediation, with supporting rationale, in data quality assessment results.
Assess data quality, using established thresholds and targets for each selected quality dimension.
Systematically generate data quality measurement reports, based on criticality of attributes and data volatility.
Continuously review and improve data quality assessment and reporting processes.
string

subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Define the mechanisms, rules, processes, and methods to validate and correct data according to predefined business rules.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Establish and maintain a data cleansing policy.
Maintain data change history through cleansing activities.

Establish methods for correcting the data and define those methods within a plan. Methods may include multiple repository comparison, verification against a valid source, logic checks, referential integrity or range tolerance.
In service level agreements, include data quality criteria to hold data providers accountable for cleansed data.
string

subComponentQuestions.subComponentName: Manage the life cycle of data assets.
subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Ensure that the organization understands, maps, inventories and controls its data flows through business processes over the data life cycle, from creation or acquisition to retirement.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Map and align the requirements of data consumers and producers.
Define business process-to-data mappings. Maintain them and periodically review them for compliance..
Follow a defined process for collaborative agreements with respect to shared data and data usage within business processes.
Implement data flows and full data-to-process life cycle maps for shared data for each major business process at the organizational level.
Ensure that changes to shared data sets or target data sets for a specific business purpose are managed by data governance structures, with relevant stakeholder engagement..
Use metrics to expand approved shared data reuse and eliminate process redundancy..
string

subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Ensure that data maintenance satisfies organizational and regulatory requirements for availability of historical data. Ensure that legal and regulatory requirements for data archiving and retention are met.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Ensure that policies mandate management of data history, including retention, destruction and audit trail requirements.
Ensure the existence of a defined method that guarantees accessibility to the historical data necessary to support business needs.
Use policy and processes to control access, transmittal and modifications to historical and archived data.
Ensure that the organization has a prescribed data warehouse repository that provides access to historical data for meeting analytics needs supporting business processes.
string
subComponentQuestions.detailedReference: Platform and Architecture—Historical Data, Retention and Archiving

subComponentQuestions.subComponentName: Manage data backup and restore arrangements.
subComponentQuestions.subComponentDescription: Manage availability of critical data to ensure operational continuity.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Define a schedule to ensure correct backup of all critical data.
Define requirements for on-site and off-site storage of backup data, taking into account volume, capacity and retention period, in alignment with the business requirements.
Establish a testing schedule for backup data. Ensure that the data can be restored correctly without drastically impacting business.
string
subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: The CIS Critical Security Controls for Effective Cyber Defense Version 6.1, August 2016

componentQuestions.policyDescription: Outlines management’s commitment to data cleansing. Prescribes frequency, guidelines and accountability; documents available methods, solutions and tools.

Describes the organization’s data quality assurance assessment philosophy for ensuring the integrity of the data being used to make decisions that impact the organization. Assigns the frequency, guidelines and accountability for data quality assessment. Outlines available methods, solutions and tools.
componentQuestions.detailedGuidance: (1) CMMI Data Management Maturity Model, 2014; (2) National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800- 53, Revision 5 (Draft), August 2017
componentQuestions.detailedReference: (1) Data Quality Assessment; (2) 3.20 System and information integrity (SI-1)

componentQuestions.policyDescription: Describes the organization’s commitment to manage data assets across the data life cycle, from creation through delivery, maintenance and archiving.

Documents the collection, use, disclosure and management of personal data. Personal data can be any data that may be used to identify an individual, including, but not limited to, name, address, date of birth, marital status, contact information, ID issue and expiry date, financial records, credit information, medical history, travel destination, and intent to acquire goods or services. The privacy policy defines how an enterprise collects, stores and releases personal information; how and when the client is informed of specific information that is collected and whether it is kept confidential, shared with partners, or sold to other firms or enterprises. The policy mandates compliance with relevant legislation related to data protection.

componentQuestions.keyCultureElement: Create a culture of shared responsibility for the organization’s data assets;acknowledge the potential value of data assets and ensure that roles and responsibilities are clear for governance and management of data assets.

Create awareness around data integrity, accuracy, completeness and protection to establish a culture of data quality. Relate data quality to the enterprise’s core values. Continuously communicate the impact and risk of data loss. Ensure that employees understand the  true cost of failing to implement a data quality culture.
